SENT.plain: We examined and managed two patients with posterior fossa dural arteriovenous malformations (DAVMs) and papilledema
Both DAVMs had venous drainage into the transverse, straight, and sigmoid dural venous sinuses
The mechanism of papilledema in the first case was presumed venous hypertension resulting in impaired cerebrospinal fluid absorption, as the malformation drained into the single transverse sinus
This was cured by selective arterial embolization of the causative DAVM
The second patient had venous sinus thrombosis that impaired venous drainage despite embolization
A lumboperitoneal shunt was necessary to treat the elevated intracranial pressure
